video.title: World Without End
video.synopsis: Set in 14th-century England, this sequel to "The Pillars of the Earth" picks up events 200 years later as the king initiates the Hundred Years War.

episodes.synopsis: In the aftermath of a civil war in 14th-century England, Queen Isabella defeats and imprisons her husband, Edward II.
episodes.title: Knight

episodes.synopsis: Seven years have passed, and the annual Fleece Fair at Kingsbridge suffers poor attendance from merchants put off by its deteriorating bridge.
episodes.title: King

episodes.synopsis: Caris takes charge of the casualties after the bridge collapse, bringing them to the cathedral.
episodes.title: Prior

episodes.synopsis: A year later, the Fleece Fair is even more sparsely attended. When Gwenda arrives to sell her wares, there are fewer customers than ever.
episodes.title: Check

episodes.synopsis: Almost a decade later in France, Edward III needs to find a way for his army to safely cross the River Somme.
episodes.title: Pawns

episodes.synopsis: As Caris and Mair disembark in England, no one notices the rats that scamper from the ship to the dock.
episodes.title: Rook

episodes.synopsis: Edward III bids farewell to his teenage daughter Joan as she leaves to Spain to marry the Prince of Castile, an ally against France.
episodes.title: Queen

episodes.synopsis: Advised by Petranilla, Ralph uses this revolt against his own tyranny to convince Queen Isabella that peasants are rebelling against the crown.
episodes.title: Checkmate
